title: Documentation
content:
Welcome to Our Documentation# This is a collaborative documentation site built with Hugo and the Book theme.
Feel free to contribute by submitting a pull request!

title: Getting Started
content:
Getting Started# Welcome! This documentation is open for contributions from everyone.
Quick Links# How to Contribute Writing Guide

title: Introduction
content:
Introduction# This is your first documentation page.
What is this site?# This is a collaborative documentation site where anyone can contribute content through GitHub pull requests.
Features# Easy to contribute: Just submit a PR with your markdown content Beautiful theme: Using the Hugo Book theme Automatic deployment: Changes are automatically published via GitHub Actions Search enabled: Full-text search across all documentation

title: Writing Guide
content:
Writing Guide# Creating a New Page# Create a new markdown file in the appropriate section under content/docs/ Add front matter at the top: --- title: "Your Page Title" weight: 1 --- Write your content in Markdown Markdown Basics# Headers# # H1 Header ## H2 Header ### H3 HeaderLinks# [Link text](https://example.com)Code Blocks# Use triple backticks for code: def hello(): print(“Hello, world!”)
Images# ![Alt text](/images/image.png)Organizing Content# The Book theme uses the file structure to create the menu. Files are ordered by the weight parameter in the front matter (lower numbers appear first).
Example Structure# content/ └── docs/ ├── _index.md (Section homepage) ├── section-1/ │ ├── _index.md │ ├── page-1.md │ └── page-2.md └── section-2/ ├── _index.md └── page-1.md

title: How to Contribute
content:
How to Contribute# Prerequisites# A GitHub account Docker installed on your computer Git installed on your computer Step-by-Step Process# 1. Fork the Repository# Click the “Fork” button at the top right of the GitHub repository page.
2. Clone Your Fork# git clone https://github.com/YOUR-USERNAME/my-hugo-site.git cd my-hugo-site3. Run Locally with Docker# docker-compose upVisit http://localhost:1313 to see your local version.
4. Create a New Branch# git checkout -b add-my-documentation5. Add Your Content# Create a new markdown file in the appropriate section under content/docs/.
Example:
# Create a new file nano content/docs/my-section/my-page.mdAdd this content:
--- title: "My New Page" weight: 1 --- # My New Page Your content here...6. Test Your Changes# The site should automatically reload at http://localhost:1313. Check that your page appears in the menu and looks correct.
7. Commit Your Changes# git add . git commit -m "Add documentation about XYZ"8. Push to Your Fork# git push origin add-my-documentation9. Create a Pull Request# Go to your fork on GitHub Click “Pull requests” → “New pull request” Select your branch Add a description of your changes Click “Create pull request” What Happens Next?# GitHub Actions will automatically build your changes to verify they work A maintainer will review your pull request Once approved and merged, your changes will be automatically deployed!

title: Contributing
content: Contributing to This Documentation# We welcome contributions! This section explains how to add or edit content.
